decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the board with low-cost artifacts to generate mana and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Mox Opal, Springleaf Drum, and Mishra's Bauble to ramp up mana production, while using Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer to deal damage efficiently. Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt provide disruption against opponents' strategies, while Urza's Saga and Weapons Manufacturing help to consistently generate threats. The inclusion of cards like Cranial Plating and Lavaspur Boots also enhance the deck's offensive capabilities.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to maximize damage output early in the game, using efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, backed up by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. The deck also incorporates disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to control the board. With a strong mana base and access to powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and finish them off before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various spells and card advantage while also ramping up mana for powerful late-game plays. It utilizes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Stock Up for control, while Ephemerate and Eternal Witness provide recurring value. Wrenn and Six help with mana fixing and card advantage, while Omnath, Locus of Creation and Quantum Riddler serve as win conditions. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana sources and versatility in casting spells.

This aggro deck focuses on utilizing creatures with powerful abilities to disrupt opponent's plans while maintaining pressure on the board. By combining death and taxes elements, the deck aims to control the game tempo through efficient removal and disruptive effects. The deck includes creatures with abilities that can exile threats, protect key pieces, and generate card advantage. Additionally, the deck utilizes enchantments to support its creatures and provide additional utility. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around leveraging creatures with impactful abilities to dictate the flow of the game and come out on top.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful combo using Broodscale Bloodchief's ability to sacrifice creatures for powerful effects, along with cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Blade of the Bloodchief to maximize their potential. It also includes utility cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista for extra versatility. The deck aims to quickly ramp up its resources with cards like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple, while utilizing powerful spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on combining creatures like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker with Blade of the Bloodchief to create a powerful synergy. It also includes key cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the board while ramping into threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. With the support of Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a creature-based win condition. Additionally, the deck utilizes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful reanimation spells such as Goryo's Vengeance to quickly bring back key creatures like Griselbrand. By combining this strategy with efficient control elements like Force of Negation and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent while setting up its combo finish. Cards like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate help to dig for combo pieces and protect key threats while also providing value over multiple turns. Additionally, the deck features a diverse land base to support its color requirements and maximize consistency in executing its game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual to cast powerful creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Coiling Oracle. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Flare of Denial and Sink into Stupor to control the board and protect your creatures. The inclusion of cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation helps maintain tempo and disrupt opponents' strategies. With a mix of ramp, control, and powerful creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggro pressure while maintaining control of the board.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. It utilizes cards like Devourer of Destiny and Sire of Seven Deaths to put pressure on the opponent early on, while also using disruption and removal spells like Thought-Knot Seer and Kozilek's Command to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also takes advantage of mana acceleration from Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls to help cast its high-cost Eldrazi creatures efficiently. It aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures and utilizing spells like Kozilek's Command and Ancient Stirrings to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Eldrazi Linebreaker and Thought-Knot Seer, along with utility cards like Wastescape+Battlemage','','');">Wastescape Battlemage and World Breaker, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats. The mana base includes Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls to help cast Eldrazi creatures early, while also providing access to different colors of mana for spells like Ugin's Labyrinth and other utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler. Quantum Riddler and Witch Enchanter provide additional utility and control options. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans while applying pressure with its creatures, eventually overwhelming them with a combination of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and powerful threats like Emperor of Bones. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to all its spells.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. Atraxa, Grand Unifier acts as a way to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent. Control elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize help stall the game until the combo can be assembled. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Prismatic Ending to deal with threats. Overall, the goal is to efficiently combo off and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures before they can respond effectively.

This deck utilizes powerful instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to quickly bring back key combo pieces like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. By leveraging cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler to control the board while setting up the combo, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of powerful creatures and disruptive spells. With a mix of removal, hand disruption, and card draw, the deck seeks to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with key creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand, then use powerful reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick win. Cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler help with card selection and manipulation, while removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending help control the board. Faithful Mending and Ephemerate provide additional card draw and recursion options. The inclusion of Thoughtseize and Force of Negation help to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage to the opponent while disrupting their game plan with spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration are used for card advantage and setting up the next plays. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, using efficient spells and creatures to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck also includes some protection with Slickshot Show-Off and Mutagenic Growth to ensure that your threats can connect with the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through disruption and powerful threats, while leveraging the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp into big plays. Devourer of Destiny and Thought-Knot Seer provide early game pressure and disruption, while Glaring Fleshraker and Sire of Seven Deaths offer powerful late-game threats. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms support the controlling strategy, while Eldrazi Temple and the Urza lands enable quick mana acceleration. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies and close out games with overwhelming threats.
